problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous video clip.
Check all the following which are true, regarding classical repetition codes:

choice.text: For an [mathjaxinline]n=3[/mathjaxinline] bit repetition code, up to two arbitrary bit flip errors can be corrected.
For an [mathjaxinline]n=7[/mathjaxinline] bit repetition code, up to three arbitrary bit flip errors can be corrected.
Suppose the error is such that either three bits flip, or no bits flip; then for [mathjaxinline]n=4[/mathjaxinline], three bit flips can be corrected.
Decoding is accomplished by taking the majority function of the bits.
Decoding is done by taking the AND of the bits.
